definition[0]: the number of people who attend a game, concert, meeting etc
example[0]: We have an average attendance of 4,000 fans per game.
example[1]: Last yearâ€™s fair saw attendance figures of 32,000.
definition[1]: when someone goes to a meeting, class etc, or an occasion when they go
example[2]: The doctor will have a record of her attendances.
example[3]: Most courses involve an average of eight hours' attendance at college each week.
definition[2]: the number of people who attend something such as a meeting, or who go to see an event such as a football match etc
example[4]: Seven jobs were axed at the zoo after a 50% drop in attendances.
definition[3]: the fact that you go to something that is held regularly, or the number of times that you go
example[5]: the attendance of Scottish companies at European events
example[6]: The school has introduced rewards for good attendance.
